flawed_nl_solution:
If there are 600 people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is 2*600 = <<2*600=1200>>1200.
The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals 1200+600 = <<1200+600=180>>180
The number of people who went to that fair last year was 200 less than those going next year, meaning there were 1200-200 = 1000 people at the fair last year.
In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be 180 of this and next year + 1000 of last year = <<180+1000=1180>>1180
#### 1180

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1800, not 180. It appears a zero was dropped from the number.
